page.title: 12Religion in our Valley
page.content: Most of the places of worship are Nonconformist chapels. There are two churches which are Welsh which are St. Davids in the Wyndham and St. Johns in Ogmore Vale. Some chapels have closed and one is now a carpet and furniture house and another is a scout and guide centre. In my school out of 149 children, 25 go to church or chapel regularly and 21 go now and then. My father is Vicar of St. Davids and we live in the Vicarage in Wyndham. About 30 people attend the Sunday services. The Welsh language is now only used regularly in one chapel in Ogmore Vale, that being the Bethlehem Chapel.
